original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down; Rupee closes 321/323
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s treasury bond and bill yields closed down on Tuesday, while rupee appreciated following the International Monetary Fund approval on the extended loan facility, dealers said.
A 01.07.2025 bond closed at 30.25/75 percent on Tuesday, down from 30.75/31.25 percent on Monday.
A 15.09.2027 bond closed at 27.90/28.00 percent, down from 28.00/20 percent from Monday.
The one-year bill closed at 23.00/24.00 percent, down from its last close at 25.25/30 percent.
Rupee closed at stronger at 321/323 against the US dollar on Tuesday, from 332/335 on Monday. (Colombo/ March21/2023)
